text: Richard Nelson Bolles (March 19, 1927 â€“ March 31, 2017) was an American Episcopal clergyman and writer. He was known for being the author of the best- selling job-hunting book, What Color is Your Parachute?. Bolles was born in Milwaukee, Wisconsin. He studied at Harvard University. Bolles died on March 31, 2017 in Danville, California, aged 90. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:1927 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Disease-related deaths in California Category:Writers from Milwaukee
title: Richard Nelson Bolles
